[vc_row][vc_column css=".vc_custom_1513602728692{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1514471072306{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]Even after school's out for the day, children need to be engaged in a comfortable, yet stimulating child care environment. Our before- and after-school child care program allows kindergarten and school-age children to balance learning and fun through a variety of experiences. From homework help to fun physical activities, our early education program is designed so that everyone goes home happy.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width="1/2" css=".vc_custom_1513602734541{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1514471106434{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]Example Activity: “What Would You Do?” is an activity that encourages students to question what is right and wrong in a situation. In this activity children have discussions about topics like ethical dilemmas, which teaches them how to develop positive values like honesty, fairness, and kindness, all while expressing their opinions in their own unique way. Literacy activities include identifying rhyming words and creating group stories on the flannel board. Math activities focus on positional words, identifying and creating shapes, and on measuring.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="13" img_size="full" alignment="center"][vc_single_image image="1635" img_size="full" alignment="center" css=".vc_custom_1524228991180{margin-top: -210px !important;padding-top: 20px !important;}"][vc_custom_heading text="Financial Aids" font_container="tag:p|font_size:16px|text_align:center|color:%23ffffff" use_theme_fonts="yes" link="url:%23|||" css=".vc_custom_1514201803941{margin-top: -182px !important;}"][vc_custom_heading text="Watch" font_container="tag:h3|text_align:center|color:%23ffffff" use_theme_fonts="yes" link="url:%23|||" css=".vc_custom_1514201791366{margin-top: -10px !important;margin-bottom: 90px !important;}"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column css=".vc_custom_1513602742313{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"][vc_column_text]At our centers, your child will get to express his creativity through movement, dance, drama, music, visual arts, and more! There are no limits to the imagination of a young and active mind—and at our centers, we want to make sure your child has the freedom to explore his creativity in any way that feels natural to him.

[vc_row css=".vc_custom_1514535535425{margin-bottom: 10px !important;}"][vc_column css=".vc_custom_1489757662264{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"][vc_custom_heading text="How to apply" font_container="tag:h3|text_align:left" use_theme_fonts="yes" css=".vc_custom_1514535407675{margin-top: 0px !important;margin-bottom: 15px !important;}"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1514535463090{margin-bottom: 25px !important;}"]

Stepping on the campus of School, you enter an extraordinary place for children. It is a place where all of our energies are dedicated to helping children become their best selves. We purposefully create an environment to meet their needs from early childhood to emerging adolescence. We are pioneers in providing a leading-edge academic experience, and we are fundamentally committed to helping all of our students become people of strong character.

[/vc_column_text][vc_btn title="Application process details" style="outline-custom" outline_custom_color="#000000" outline_custom_hover_background="#000000" outline_custom_hover_text="#ffffff" shape="square" css=".vc_custom_1514535501288{margin-bottom: 45px !important;}"][vc_separator border_width="4"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1514535663194{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"][vc_column css=".vc_custom_1489757662264{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"][vc_custom_heading text="Application dates" font_container="tag:h3|text_align:left" use_theme_fonts="yes" css=".vc_custom_1514535413617{margin-top: 0px !important;margin-bottom: 15px !important;}"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1514535575313{margin-bottom: 25px !important;}"]We have three application rounds for the Class of 2020 (matriculating fall 2018): September 6, 2017, January 3, 2018 and April 2, 2018. [vc_row][vc_column css=".vc_custom_1513602728692{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"][vc_column_text]Even after school's out for the day, children need to be engaged in a comfortable, yet stimulating child care environment. Our before- and after-school child care program allows kindergarten and school-age children to balance learning and fun through a variety of experiences. From homework help to fun physical activities, our early education program is designed so that everyone goes home happy.

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width="1/2" css=".vc_custom_1513602734541{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"][vc_column_text]Example Activity: “What Would You Do?” is an activity that encourages students to question what is right and wrong in a situation. In this activity children have discussions about topics like ethical dilemmas, which teaches them how to develop positive values like honesty, fairness, and kindness, all while expressing their opinions in their own unique way. Literacy activities include identifying rhyming words and creating group stories on the flannel board. Math activities focus on positional words, identifying and creating shapes, and on measuring.

[vc_row][vc_column css=".vc_custom_1489757662264{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"][vc_custom_heading text="Inclusion by providing access to our world-class curriculum programs, embracing inclusive participation in our programs, and offering support." font_container="tag:h4|text_align:left|color:%23000000" use_theme_fonts="yes"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1514546545057{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]Stepping on the campus of School, you enter an extraordinary place for children. It is a place where all of our energies are dedicated to helping children become their best selves. We purposefully create an environment to meet their needs from early childhood to emerging adolescence. We are pioneers in providing a leading-edge academic experience, and we are fundamentally committed to helping all of our students become people of strong character.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]
Inclusion is not just a strategy for helping certain children overcome challenges; inclusion is a way of life.

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1514460837865{margin-top: 30px !important;}"][vc_column width="1/2" css=".vc_custom_1524228607308{margin-bottom: 0px !important;border-left-width: 4px !important;padding-left: 20px !important;background-color: #f5f5f5 !important;border-left-color: #f8c000 !important;border-left-style: solid !important;}" offset="vc_col-sm-offset-3"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1514460793874{margin-top: 0px !important;margin-bottom: 20px !important;padding-left: 15px !important;}"]There may sometimes be places available in other year groups.  Entry is selective and via an appropriate test and/or interview at each stage.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1514460842209{margin-top: 30px !important;margin-bottom: 40px !important;}"][vc_column width="1/2" css=".vc_custom_1524228611862{margin-bottom: 0px !important;border-left-width: 4px !important;padding-left: 20px !important;background-color: #f5f5f5 !important;border-left-color: #f8c000 !important;border-left-style: solid !important;}" offset="vc_col-sm-offset-3"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1511360704561{margin-top: 0px !important;margin-bottom: 35px !important;padding-left: 15px !important;}"]Information for entry procedures at each point is given here and we warmly invite you to an open day to learn more.  You are also most welcome to contact us if you meed more information at any stage.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

tribe_events.post_excerpt: If you are not a student and have a question, you can call: 1-800-275-4410 or email an Admissions Specialist. Fax: 1-570-961-4030. Address: Penn Foster Career School. Student CARE Center, 925 Oak Street, Scranton, PA 18515 USA.

agc_course.post_excerpt: It is an introduction to basic skills and movement by participation and instruction in the following activities.

agc_course.post_content: This course is a freshman orientation to physical education, physical fitness, and health. It is an introduction to basic skills and movement by participation and instruction in the following activities: swimming, dance, duel and individual sports, and physical fitness.

Undergraduate degree programs in industrial arts train students to craft wood and metal, repair machinery, use hand tools, make technical drawings, prepare food, and design such items as clothes, furniture and appliances.

Foundations of Art. Introduces students to the materials, techniques, concepts, and processes essential to understanding the visual arts and the role of the artist, through a series of projects, readings, class critiques, videos, slide presentations, and various kinds of field trips.
Second semester of the two-semester sequence MATH 101-102. Seminar times will be arranged during the first week of classes.

This class introduces students to the rudiments of Western music through oral, aural, and written practice utilizing rhythm, melody, intervals, scales, chords, and musical notation. The approach is based upon the inclusive Kodály philosophy of music education.
This course is a global-oriented survey of the history of architecture, from the ... Introduction to the History and Theory of Architecture ... Course Description.

This course acquaints students with astronomy concepts including basic facts about the Earth, moon, and stars. Also included for study are galaxies, cosmology, and space exploration. Emphasizes the interrelationships of physical geography, chemistry, geology and biological studies in the ocean environment.

English language courses cover beginning, intermediate and advanced levels of speaking, reading and writing in English, including grammar and literature skills. They're normally taken as part of a full degree program related to English.

testimonial.post_content: Here is always singing new songs and expressing new ideas he learned at school.
